alert.note: Alert for Adams (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 11:43AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN TENSAS... CONCORDIA...CATAHOULA PARISHES IN NORTHEASTERN LOUISIANA AND ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM CDT... At 1142 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Harrisonburg to near Clayton to near Deer Park. Movement was south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Natchez, Ferriday, Jonesville, Ridgecrest, Deer Park, Wildsville, Frogmore, and Wallace Ridge around 1150 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
